ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, if you want to learn German (you should, it's great).
Sure! Learned a lot, looking to take German L. 2 next semester as well.
Would recommend: I feel like I can now have basic conversations in German; if I were a tourist in Germany, I think I could get by.
GMAN 110 was tough with the workload especially because it was every day but it was fun and I didn't mind having it everyday because of that.

I would recommend GMAN 110 to a fellow student but would caution them that the course moves quickly and there is a fair amount of small homework assignments. These can be time-consuming but are important for measuring what you've learned in class. The class in general has a heavier workload than most Yale classes as far as frequency of assignments but not in terms of difficulty.
This course didnt live up to my expectation of a Yale class. Take the intensive L1/L2 if you pick up languages easily and are committed to learning German.

Yes I recommend it. Good course. Prepare for a fair amount of work (class every day plus assignments all the time) Strengths: lots of practice and different types of exercises (final project, homework, email buddy, video assignments..etc) kept things interesting. Improvements: more spoken practice - I feel I still don't have enough confidence to go out there and speak freely. Random due dates for assignment meant lots of students missed deadlines.
